event: Island first inhabited by Ciboney, then Arawak, and later the Carib (Kalinago) peoples.
Spanish explorers reportedly sight Saint Lucia; named by early Europeans.
English settlers attempt to colonize the island but are repelled by the Caribs.
French successfully establish a permanent settlement on Saint Lucia.
Treaty signed with the Caribs; French consolidate control.
British take control of Saint Lucia.
Treaty of Breda returns Saint Lucia to the French.
Saint Lucia changes hands between France and Britain 14 times during the 18th century.
Treaty of Paris cedes Saint Lucia permanently to Britain.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; enslaved population on Saint Lucia emancipated.
Becomes an associated state of the UK with full internal self-government.
Saint Lucia gains full independence from the United Kingdom on February 22.
John Compton becomes Prime Minister, beginning a period of political stability.
Hurricane Ivan causes significant damage to the island.
Hurricane Tomas strikes Saint Lucia, causing fatalities and infrastructure damage.
Allen Chastanet elected Prime Minister following general elections.
Philip J. Pierre becomes Prime Minister amid continued economic recovery efforts.
